  16. #ifndef CAML_FINALISE_H
  17. ‌#define CAML_FINALISE_H

  19. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  21. #include "roots.h"
  22. #include "domain.h"

  24. ‌struct final {
  25.   value fun;
  26.   value val;
  27.   int offset;
  28. };

  30. ‌struct finalisable {
  31.   struct final *table;
  32.   uintnat old;
  33.   uintnat young;
  34.   uintnat size;
  35. };
  36. /* [0..old) : finalisable set, the values are in the major heap
  37.    [old..young) : recent set, the values could be in the minor heap
  38.    [young..size) : free space

  40.    The element of the finalisable set are moved to the finalising set
  41.    below when the value are unreachable (for the first or last time).

  43. */

  45. ‌struct final_todo {
  46.   struct final_todo *next;
  47.   int size;
  48.   struct final item[1];  /* variable size */
  49. };

  51. /*
  52.   todo_head: head of the list of finalisation functions that can be run.
  53.   todo_tail: tail of the list of finalisation functions that can be run.

  55.   It is the finalising set.
  56. */

  58. ‌struct caml_final_info {
  59.   struct finalisable first;
  60.   uintnat updated_first;
  61.   struct finalisable last;
  62.   uintnat updated_last;
  63.   struct final_todo *todo_head;
  64.   struct final_todo *todo_tail;
  65.   uintnat running_finalisation_function;
  66.   struct caml_final_info* next; /* used for orphaned finalisers.
  67.                                    See major_gc.c */
  68. };

  70. void caml_final_merge_finalisable (struct finalisable *source,
  71.                                    struct finalisable *target);
  72. int caml_final_update_first (caml_domain_state* d);
  73. int caml_final_update_last (caml_domain_state* d);

  77.   caml_domain_state* domain, int do_val);

  80.   caml_domain_state* d, int do_last_val);
